titleStmt.title: Loves tyrannick conquest. Love and beauty have such power sometimes joyes they do devour and those that of their power are tasting sighing dayly still are wasting. Tune of, Blush no redder than the morning.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for C. Hussey at the Flower-de-luce in Little Brittain,

notesStmt.note: Verse from music: "Cupid, leave thy tyranizing, thou are still new pains devising, pains too great to be endured ..."
Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
